    • Method Detail

      • downloadImageBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap downloadImageBitmap(java.lang.String imageUrl)
        Downloads an image and returns a bitmap object. The image should be less than 450dp for the push notification. An aspect ratio of 2:1 is recommended. This should always be run in a background thread. According to http://developer.android.com/guide/appendix/media-formats.html, the supported file types are jpg and png.
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - The url where the image is found
        Returns:
        An image in Bitmap form. If the image cannot be downloaded, or cannot be decoded into a bitmap, then null is returned.

      • getPixelsFromDensityAndDp

        public static int getPixelsFromDensityAndDp(int dpi,
                            int dp)

      • storeBitmapLocally

        public static android.net.Uri storeBitmapLocally(android.content.Context context,
                                 android.graphics.Bitmap imageBitmap,
                                 java.lang.String imageFilenameBase,
                                 java.lang.String folderName)
        Store the given bitmap image locally as a png file in the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        imageBitmap - image bitmap
        imageFilenameBase - desired image filename, without file extension
        folderName - image folder name
        Returns:
        the image Uri, or null if saving locally failed.

      • isWriteExternalPermissionGranted

        public static boolean isWriteExternalPermissionGranted(android.content.Context context)
        Checks whether writing to external storage is allowed. Writing to external storage is necessary to store an image locally. Client apps must add to their AndroidManifest.xml.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        whether writing to external storage is allowed. Writing to external storage is necessary to store an image locally
